intro: Dipcadi firmifolium, commonly known as the firm-leaf buttercup, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its basal leaves that are broad and firm to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with numerous stamens, typical of the buttercup genus. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
